Software Ethics

Understanding responsible and legal use of software

What is Software Ethics?

Software ethics focuses on the moral and legal responsibilities involved in developing, using, sharing, and distributing software. This includes respecting software licenses, avoiding piracy, and promoting fair usage of intellectual property.

Key Areas in Software Ethics

Software Piracy

Unauthorized copying, sharing or installing of software without proper licensing or permission.

Licensing & Intellectual Property

Understanding licenses such as GPL, MIT, freeware and respecting developer rights.

Open Source vs Proprietary

Knowing the difference between open-source community projects and closed-source commercial software.

Ethical Development

Writing safe, secure, and fair software that does not harm users or invade privacy.
